Question_1.Context: The study focused on the characterization of triterpene saponins in Hedera nepalensis using UHPLC-Q-TOF-MS/MS method.
Question_1.Question: What is the main purpose of the study?
Question_1.A: To investigate the antibacterial properties of H. nepalensis
Question_1.B: To analyze the chemical constituents of H. nepalensis leaves using a specific method
Question_1.C: To study the economic importance of the Hedera genus
Question_1.D: To explore the antioxidant activities of H. nepalensis
Question_1.Source: The aim of the present study is to characterize the chemical constituents (especially triterpene saponins) of H. nepalensis leaves planted in Vietnam applying UHPLC‐Q‐TOF‐MS/MS technique.

Question_2.Context: The study identified 21 triterpene saponins in H. nepalensis.
Question_2.Question: How many triterpene saponins were elucidated in the study?
Question_2.Source: Forty-five phytochemicals including 21 triterpene saponins were characterized and eight structures have not been reported yet.

Question_3.Context: The study provided a detailed analysis of the chemical structures of triterpene saponins in H. nepalensis.
Question_3.Question: What method was primarily used to characterize the chemical structures?
Question_3.Source: Applying UHPLC‐Q‐TOF‐MS/MS method, the characterization of triterpene saponins structural information in H. nepalensis was successfully analyzed in positive and negative modes.

Question_4.Context: The study mentioned the identification of standard compounds for comparison.
Question_4.Question: Which two standard compounds were examined to clarify the MS fragmentation patterns of triterpene saponins?
Question_4.Source: Two standard compounds, α-hederin and hederacoside C, were examined by UHPLC-Q-TOF-MS/MS in order to clarify the MS fragmentation patterns of triterpene saponins.

Question_5.Context: The study discussed the differentiation of aglycones using positive ionization mode.
Question_5.Question: What are the characteristic ions for hederagenin, oleanolic acid, 30-norhederagenin, and akebonic acid under positive ESI mode?
Question_5.Source: Under the positive ESI mode, hederagenin, oleanolic acid, 30-norhederagenin, and akebonic acid showed the characteristic ion [M + H]+ at m/z 473.3631, 457.3682, 457.3318, and 441.3369, respectively.

Question_6.Context: The study provided insights into the sugar linkages of triterpene saponins.
Question_6.Question: What is the characteristic fragment ion for the loss of glucopyranosyl (Glc) in the sugar chains?
Question_6.Source: The sugar chains of triterpenoid saponins generally substitute at C‐3 and/or C‐28 position(s) of an aglycone. In the positive ESI mode, based on the characteristic fragment ions, the composition of sugar chains can be deduced as follows: the loss of glucopyranosyl (Glc) is 162 Da.

Question_7.Context: The study discussed the identification of known and new chemical structures.
Question_7.Question: What was the total number of triterpenoid saponins identified in Shizhu ginseng in 2016?
Question_7.Source: In 2016, 31 saponins in Shizhu ginseng were identified applying UHPLC‐Q‐TOF‐MS/MS.

Question_8.Context: The study highlighted the successful dereplication of Pulsatilla chinensis using UHPLC-Q-TOF-MS/MS.
Question_8.Question: How many triterpenoid saponins were successfully identified in Pulsatilla chinensis in 2018?
Question_8.Source: In 2018, UHPLC‐Q‐TOF‐MS/MS guided dereplication of Pulsatilla chinensis was successfully identified a total of 22 triterpenoid saponins with four aglycone skeletons.

Question_9.Context: The study mentioned the screening of bioactivities of H. nepalensis extracts.
Question_9.Question: What bioactivities were screened for in the methanolic extracts of H. nepalensis?
Question_9.Source: In addition, H. nepalensis was shown to contain various active compounds including saponins, affording antitumor, antioxidant, and antidiabetic activities.

Question_10.Context: The study aimed to lay a foundation for future drug discovery from H. nepalensis.
Question_10.Question: What was the primary goal of the study regarding future drug discovery?
Question_10.A: To identify novel chemical structures for drug development
Question_10.B: To investigate the economic importance of H. nepalensis
Question_10.C: To study the bioactivities of H. nepalensis extracts
Question_10.D: To analyze the phytochemicals of H. nepalensis leaves
Question_10.Source: The results of this preliminary work can assist in clarifying the chemical compositions of H. nepalensis and accelerating the new drug discovery from this valuable species.
